dt: used as a function word to indicate position in contact with and supported by the top surface of

dt.t: the book is lying {wi}on{/wi} the table

dt: used as a function word to indicate position in or in contact with an outer surface

dt.t: I have a cut {wi}on{/wi} my finger

dt: used as a function word to indicate position in close proximity with
used as a function word to indicate the location of something

dt.t: {wi}on{/wi} the south side of the house

dt: used as a function word to indicate a source of attachment or support
used as a function word to indicate a source of dependence
used as a function word to indicate means of conveyance
used as a function word to indicate presence in the possession of
used as a function word to indicate a time frame during which something takes place
or an instant, action, or occurrence when something begins or is done

dt.t: {wi}on{/wi} arriving home, I found your letter

dt: used as a function word to indicate manner of doing something
used as a function word to indicate means or agency
used as a function word to indicate a medium of expression
used as a function word to indicate active involvement in a condition or status
{bc}regularly using or showing the effects of using
used as a function word to indicate involvement or participation
used as a function word to indicate inclusion
used as a function word to indicate position or status in proper relationship with a standard or objective
used as a function word to indicate reason, ground, or basis (as for an action, opinion, or computation)

dt.t: the interest will be 10 cents {wi}on{/wi} the dollar

dt: used as a function word to indicate the cause or source
used as a function word to indicate the focus of obligation or responsibility
used as a function word to indicate the object of collision, opposition, or hostile action
used as a function word to indicate the object with respect to some disadvantage, handicap, or detriment

dt.t: has three inches in height {wi}on{/wi} me

dt: used as a function word to indicate destination or the focus of some action, movement, or directed effort
used as a function word to indicate the focus of feelings, determination, or will
used as a function word to indicate the object with respect to some misfortune or disadvantageous event
used as a function word to indicate the subject of study, discussion, or consideration
used as a function word to indicate reduplication or succession in a series

et: Middle English {it}an, on{/it}, preposition & adverb, from Old English; akin to Old High German {it}ana{/it} on, Greek {it}ana{/it} up, on

—used as a function word to indicate position in or in contact with an outer surface
—used as a function word to indicate position in close proximity with

dt: {bc}in or into a position of contact with an upper surface especially so as to be positioned for use or operation
{bc}in or into a position of being attached to or covering a surface
{bc}in or into the condition of being worn
{bc}forward or at a more advanced point in space or time
{bc}into operation or a position permitting operation

in or into a position of being attached to or covering a surface; especially : in or into the condition of being worn

dt: {bc}engaged in an activity or function (such as a dramatic role)
{bc}engaged in or as if in a performance
{bc}being at a high level of performance

placed so as to permit operation

dt: {bc}chemical compound not a ketone or other oxo compound

dt: {bc}existing briefly and in an intermittent unpredictable way

shortdef: existing briefly and in an intermittent unpredictable way

dt.t: Lucy was sick {wi}on and off{/wi} for two years before doctors were able to discover what was wrong.

utxt.t: It took more than 20 break-ups for Melissa Meagher to realise her six-year {wi}on-and-off{/wi} relationship with her ex had to end for good.

shortdef: with periodic cessation : off and on, intermittently

dt: {bc}a statistic that is expressed as a 3-digit decimal and that indicates the frequency with which a batter reaches base by a hit, a walk, or being hit by a pitch
A batter with an on-base percentage of .350 has reached base 3.5 times for every 10 at bats.

dt.t: Through Sunday he led the league in {wi}on-base percentage{/wi} (.479) and hits (40) and was second in runs scored (21) and ninth in slugging percentage (.515).
… he understood that {wi}on-base percentage{/wi} was a far better tool to evaluate a hitter than batting average …

shortdef: a statistic that is expressed as a 3-digit decimal and that indicates the frequency with which a batter reaches base by a hit, a walk, or being hit by a pitch
